website_summaries.verdict: Great resonance and dynamics control make this drum head a quality, versatile choice for all musical genres.
pros: Externally mounted adjustable damping system lets player  adjust attack and focus
Designed, engineered, and manufactured in the USA
Available in sizes from 18 to 26 inches
cons: Drum head may not be well-packaged for shipping

customer_reviews.title: Loyal Evans player
customer_reviews.text: Evans emad 2 are the only heads I use on my birch absolutes. I have them on my 18”, 20”, 22”, and 24” kicks. Durable and always sound great in every venue. I pair them with G2’s on all of my Tom tops and G1’s on the bottoms. Easy to tune and virtually indestructible. Playing for years and have tried the other brands. Evans blows them away. I’m a paid weekend warrior with no endorsers so I have to make em last a long time. What’s up, Evans, let’s talk! Ha. Still buying my heads from Amazon for the great prices and fast shipping.
customer_reviews.author: sandor

customer_reviews.title: Slappy!
customer_reviews.text: I got the 20" EMAD 2 for my Yamaha Stage Custom. I like it but don't love it. I'm glad I tried it, and am having fun playing it, and I know better what I don't want in a bass drum now. I think this head is well-suited towards rock/prog/metal as it is a 2-ply head with a LOT of attack! Very fun to play quick double strokes with this head, and it sounds flippin' nasty when tuned properly but good tuning is a must or it will sound like doo-doo. It's easy to tune on my kit compared to some other bass drums and heads I have tried
customer_reviews.author: Justin Thompson

customer_reviews.title: That sound like a cannon
customer_reviews.text: Man. No words can not be said. I have a Catalina Maple drum set. Once I placed this head on there and that first hit. It sound like a cannon. Perfect sound. It make you want to play all day. Made me want to start dancing. I have had my eyes set on the product after the few Churchs that I have been to and they have this product and I knew this would be my next purchase. If you are in the market for a new drum head. If you are a hard hitter go with the Evans EMAD2. You will not be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Will make a beginner/intermediate bass drum sound much more legit/valuable.
customer_reviews.text: I have a hardly even intermediate level kit (Yamaha DP), and it's quite a few years old. The stock head sounded absolutely terrible, even with all sorts of padding attempts on the inside and a patch on the front head. I could hardly even get it to sound actually LOW like a bass drum should..Uprgrading to the EMAD2 made an insane difference. Makes my intermediate drum sound like it's worth way more. Very nice low tone, warm, resonate (I still put a little towel inside the drum to give it more punch). I also put a Remo Falam Slam patch on it so I don't dent the head like I've done to others in the past, still sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: cooper.epps

customer_reviews.title: What can i say... best product for kick drum dynamics control
customer_reviews.text: What can i say... best product for kick drum dynamics control. I wish they would make a reverse version with the ring on the inside for a resonant head. I am in love with the elegant concept of achieving a good kick sound without stuffing anything inside of it. I achieve this now by using stick-on weather strip (along the inside). It would be cool if they produced a reversed version for this purpose.
customer_reviews.author: H Smalls

customer_reviews.title: Amazing kick head!

customer_reviews.title: Best bass drum head I have ever used!

The muffle ring that comes with it does the job and the sound / response of this head is amazingly superb! I've never had my kick drum sound this good. The projection and low end of the kick really comes alive. I used this on a Pearl Export 22". I'm never using any other head. EMAD2 for life!

customer_reviews.title: The best bass batter head ever!!!

customer_reviews.author: drumerj

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome product! With the stock batter head that came with my kit, I was getting horrible overtones and couldn't manage to get the low-end that I was looking for. Once I changed it out for this head, seated it properly, and tuned it the way that I wanted it, I couldn't have been happier! My bass drum has the proper tone that I'm looking for, has plenty of low-end, and the head is as durable as ever as well! If you add an Evans EQ Nylon Patch to it, you'll have even more protection from the beaters, increasing the longevity of this already amazing product!

The Evans EMAD2 is a great solution for making an inepensive little kick drum sound just as good as the other band's setup (much more expensive kit!). If you're having difficulty finding a nice fat kick sound give this drum head a try!

customer_reviews.title: 3-4? Maybe 5 for being made in U.S?
customer_reviews.text: Well, after tuning for a 1/2 day (mic / head, head / head, resonant / head), I got my bass to where I wanted it. Somewhere around Pantera... But, you get a good vibration, good response, short, powerful. BUT, you do need to tune it... for awhile. I have been using it in the past 1 month, and is still tuned to my like. I use Pyle mics, yamaha mixer, Linux recordings, and this works for me! I rate it 4. But if you like Remo, stick with REMO. Good luck, hope it helps.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: I've been playing drums for 40+ years and I that time have owned many different brands of drums and sizes of bass drums in that time. I've always been looking for that sound that works well mic'd or with an acoustic band: a nice solid punch with a little bit of roundness to the sound. These Evans EMAD2 heads are as close to the ideal bass drum head as I've ever used. Couldn't be happier with the sound from 18" to 20" to 22" bass drums. The interchangeable foam rings are a great idea. I highly recommend these heads for a variety of musical styles.

customer_reviews.title: Great solid sound
customer_reviews.text: I wanted the low thudding punch sound,and the Evans EMAD2 gave me the sound that I was looking for. The EMAD2 has a unique design, in that, it has a plastic "O" ring around the outer edge of the outside of the batter head. This "O" ring is used to hold one of two soft foam "O" ring that dampens the over tones. There are 2 sizes to give you the right amount of dampening, I use the larger one. It improved my kick sound tremendously! You may not even need to muffle it any, however I muffled the head with an Evans drum pad, it is very light, but works well with this head.

customer_reviews.title: Best  kick head ever!
customer_reviews.text: This head is the best! It can be tuned high or low and sound good. Having the option of the removable dampening system is great. Anytime you feel the need to change the sound you shouldn't have to tune the head differently. Simply remove the dampening ring, or change to the smaller or bigger size to get a different sound! Of course tuning your resonant head a little tighter than the batter side will give you more of a boom sound. So once you like the feel and sound of the batter side, adjust your resonant side til the sound is right for you, and your ready to ROCK!

product_meta.title: Evans EMAD2 Clear Bass Drum Head, 22” – Externally Mounted Adjustable Damping System Allows Player to Adjust Attack and Focus – 2 Foam Damping Rings for Sound Options - Versatile for All Music Genres
product_meta.description: Size:22-inch| Style:Drum HeadWhether you play rock, blues, country or metal, the Evans EMAD2 Clear Bass Drum Head is a true working drummer’s choice. Named for the externally mounted adjustable damping, the versatile system caters to all bass drum tones by allowing each player to control the attack and focus of the drum head by choosing one of two removable foam damping rings. Choosing the thinner foam ring allows for punch and focus without sacrificing resonance, while choosing the wider foam ring maximizes the low end and attack of any bass drum. The 22” drum head has an outer ply of 7mil and an inner ply of 10mil film for added durability. Enhanced with revolutionary Level 360 technology, the clear bass drum head is easier to tune, with a wider tonal range than ever before. Applying the new Level 360 collar shape to the EMAD2 bass drum head allows it to seat itself properly and in turn provides a head that is easy to tune and a sound that is studio ready. Evans EMAD2 clear bass drum heads are available in sizes 18” to 26” with multiple thickness and coating options. For over 60 years, Evans Drumheads has been a pioneer in drum head manufacturing and design. Now part of D’Addario & Company, Inc., Evans products are proudly made in a state-of-the-art manufacturing facility in the USA to the most stringent quality controls in the industry. The D’Addario family’s heart, soul and love for making music is put into every drum and accessory we create, and we never stop inspiring performance.
